oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Charlotte Avenue Church of Christ
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Charlotte Avenue Church of Christ, built in 1921, is the second structure erected to house its members at the corner of Charlotte and Forty-Sixth Avenues. Originally, church members met at an old railroad depot at Forty-First and Charlotte. In the 1950's some additions were made to the 1921 structure including an enlarged auditorium that seats 1,515 as well as a smaller chapel for weddings and funerals. 3 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Charlotte Avenue Church of Christ
Architecture; Churches
Nashville (Tenn.); Charlotte Avenue
